meanings.definition: To turn aside or away from a straight line or course.
meanings.sent1: The car had to deflex around the fallen tree on the road.
meanings.sent2: She deflexed her gaze from the distracting noise outside.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to deflex the laser pointer beam but ended up chasing its own tail.
meanings.sent4: His plan to deflex the attention away from his mistake backfired.
meanings.sent5: The river deflexed sharply to avoid the large boulder in its path.

meanings.definition: To bend or deviate from a straight line or course.
meanings.sent1: The gymnast had to deflex her body to perform the backbend.
meanings.sent2: The road deflexed sharply around the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The tree branches seemed to deflex in a dance with the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts deflexed from the task at hand to memories of childhood.
meanings.sent5: The detective's investigation deflexed towards a new suspect in the case.
